intro: Dodecatheon radicatum subsp. monanthum, commonly known as the single-flowered glory-of-the-snow, is a perennial herb native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has hairy stems and broad, oval-shaped leaves. It produces a single flower per stem, which is a distinguishing feature of this subspecies. The plant is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
